data.title: Timelines and Soundtracks: Charlie Chaplin
data.meta_description: Sir Charles Spencer "Charlie" Chaplin , (16 April 1889 – 25 December 1977) was an English comic actor, filmmaker, and composer who rose to...
data.text:
Charlie Chaplin | Timeline

Sir Charles Spencer "Charlie" Chaplin, (16 April 1889 – 25 December 1977) was an English comic actor, filmmaker, and composer who rose to fame in the silent era. Chaplin became a worldwide icon through his screen persona "the Tramp" and is considered one of the most important figures in the history of the film industry. His career spanned more than 75 years, from childhood in the Victorian era until a year before his death in 1977, and encompassed both adulation and controversy. (Intro from Wikipedia)

April 16, 1889 - London - Charles Chaplin is born

June 29, 1895 - While in London - His mother Hannah Chaplin is admited to the Lambeth Infirmary (because of headaches related to Syphilis)

June 18, 1896 - Hanwell - Charles and his brother Sydney are taken to an orphanage in Hanwell

November 11, 1897 - Hanwell - The guardians of the two brothers decide that they should return to their father

January 18, 1898 - London - Returns to his father's house

January(?) 1(?), 1899 - ? - Chaplin becomes a member of the Eight Lancashire Lads clog-dancing troupe

December 26, 1900 - London - Charles is controversially comic as a cat in a production of Cinderella at the London Hippodrome

May 13, 1901 - ? - Charles Sr. dies

July 1(?), 1903 - West End, London - first theatre role as a newsboy in H. A. Saintsbury's "Jim, a Romance of Cockayne"

October 1(?) - 1905 - West End, London - After 2 years in the role of Billy the Pageboy, in a production of "Sherlock Holmes", he is invited to play the role alongside William Gillette, the original Holmes

May 1(?), 1906 - ? - Chaplin joins the "Casey's Circus" group and becomes the star of the show

February 1(?), 1908 - London - Chaplin causes impact in an audition at the London Coliseum

April 1(?), 1910 - London - Chaplin receives attention from the press with his new sketch "Jimmy the fearless"

October 3, 1910 - New York City - Opens in the Karno Production "The Wow Wows" at the Colonial Theatre

June 1(?), 1912 - London - The troupe returns to England after 21 months of american tour

August 1(?), 1912 - ? - Start of a new Tour

September 1(?), 1913 - Edendale, California - Chaplin signs contract with Keystone Studios =(START)

December 1(?), 1913 - Los Angeles - Chaplin arrives in Los Angeles

February 2, 1914 - Los Angeles - Release of Chaplin's first movie - "Making a living"

February 7, 1914 - Los Angeles - Release of "Kid Auto Races at Venice" - First time of "the Tramp" on screen.

May 4, 1914 - Los Angeles - Chaplin's directorial debut with "Caught in the Rain"

November 14, 1914 - ? - Stars in Tillie's Punctured Romance, his first feature-lenght comedy

December 20(?), 1914 - Niles, California - Chaplin signs contract with Essanay Film Manufacturing Company

December 1(?), 1915 - Niles, California - The contract with Essanay ends, after 14 movies

February 27, 1916 - Edendale, California - Chaplin starts working for Mutual Film Corporation

January 22, 1917 - ? - Release of "Easy Street"

June 7, 1917 - ? - Chaplin signs contract with First National Exhibitors Circuit for 8 movies

October 1(?), 1917 - Honolulu, Hawaii - Arrives in Honolulu, Hawaii

November 1(?), 1917 - Hollywood, Los Angeles - Chaplin starts building his own studios off Sunset Boulevard. Completes construction in January 1918

April 14, 1918 - ? - Release of "A Dog's life"

October 23, 1918 - ? - Chaplin marries pregnant Mildred Harris to avoid controversy

April 1(?), 1920 - ? - End of his marriage with Mildred Harris

January 21, 1921 - Los Angeles(?) - Release of "The Kid"

November 25, 1924 - Mexico - Chaplin marries pregnant 16-year old Lita Grey

May 5, 1925 - Los Angeles - Charles Spencer Chaplin Jr is born

June 26, 1925 - Los Angeles(?) - Release of "The Gold Rush"

January 11, 1926 - Hollywood - Filming of "The Circus" begins at Charlie Chaplin Studios

March 30, 1926 - Los Angeles - Sydney Earl Chaplin is born

January 6, 1928 - New York City - Premiere of "The Circus" at the Strand Theatre

January 27, 1928 - Los Angeles - Premiere of "The Circus" at the Grauman's Chinese Theatre

August 28, 1928 - ? - Hannah Chaplin, Charlie's mother, dies. Chaplin is distressed for weeks

December 27, 1928 - Los Angeles - Chaplin begins filming "City Lights"

July 29, 1929 - Los Angeles - Chaplin finishes shooting the famous suicidal millionaire scene

January 30, 1931 - Los Angeles - Gala Premiere of "City Lights" at the Los Angeles Theater. Albert Einstein is guest of honor

February 6, 1931 - New York - Attends the Premiere of "City Lights" at the George M. Cohan Theatre in New York

February 13, 1931 - New York - Chaplin sails to Europe for a publicity tour of "City Lights"

March 3, 1931 - London - Luncheon at the House of Commons with Lady Astor, Lloyd George and Kirkwood

March 13, 1931 - Berlin - Meets the ministers of the Reichstag

March 15, 1931 - Berlin(?) - Tea with Alfred Einstein

March 16, 1931 - Vienna - Visits Vienna

March 21, 1931 - Venice, Italy - Tea with the British Consul

March 23, 1931 - Paris - Arrives in Paris. Lunch with Aristide Briand

March 27, 1931 - Paris - Chaplin receives the "Legion d'honneur" from Aristide Briand

June 1(?), 1931 - Grasse, SE France - Chaplin stays with H.G.Wells in Grasse

August 14, 1931 - Biarritz - Dinner with Winston Churchill in Biarritz

September 19, 1931 - Chartwell - Weekend with Winston Churchill at Chartwell

Gandhi and Charlie Chaplin, 1931

September 22, 1931 - London - Interview with Mahatma Gandhi

February 27, 1932 - London - Chaplin begins a "City Lights" 16-dates World Tour, starting in London's Dominion Theatre

March 6, 1932 - Naples, Italy - Boards the ocean liner "Suwa Maru"

March 10, 1932 - Port Said, Egypt - "Suwa Maru" arrives in Port Said

March 27, 1932 - Singapore - Arrives in Singapore on board the "Suwa Maru"

March 28, 1932 - Singapore - Departs to Batavia (Jakarta) on board the steamship "Van Lansberge"

April 20, 1932 - Singapore - Returns to Singapore after 18 days in Bali with Dengue fever

April 26, 1932 - Singapore - Discharged from Hospital

May 6, 1932 - Singapore - The Chaplin brothers depart for Japan on board the "Terukuni Maru"

May 14, 1932 - Kobe, Japan - "Terukuni Maru" arrives in Kobe, Japan

May 15, 1932 - Tokyo, Japan - Survives an assassination attempt at the Prime Minister's house, because the Prime Minister's son took him to watch a sumo match

June 10, 1932 - Hollywood - Returns to Hollywood

October 11, 1934 - Los Angeles(?) - Chaplin begins filming "Modern Times"

August 30, 1935 - Los Angeles(?) - "Modern Times" is finished filming

February 5, 1936 - Los Angeles(?) - Release of "Modern Times"

March 9, 1936 - Shanghai, China - "S.S.Coolidge" docks in Shanghai

March 18, 1936 - Singapore - Arrives in Singapore on board the "Suwa Maru"

March 24, 1936 - Batavia (Jakarta) - Chaplin flies to Batavia to begin his tour of the Dutch East Indies (Indonesia)

April 7, 1936 - Singapore - Chaplin lands in Singapore from Batavia

April 10, 1936 - Singapore - The Chaplin brothers board the french liner "Aramis" to Indochina

April 12, 1936 - Saigon, Indochina - The "Aramis" arrives in Saigon

April 18, 1936 - Phnom Penh, Cambodia - The "Aramis" arrives in Phnom Penh

April 19, 1936 - Angkor, Cambodia - Visit to Angkor

May 12, 1936 - While in Indochina(?) - Premiere of "Modern Times" in Singapore

June 1(?), 1936 - Canton, China - Charlie Chaplin marries Paulette Goddard in secret

September 1, 1939 - Los Angeles(?) - Chaplin starts filming "The Great Dictator"

October 15, 1940 - New York City - Release of "The Great Dictator"

June 4, 1942 - Mexico - Chaplin grants Paulette Goddard a mexican divorce

June 16, 1943 - Carpinteria, California - 54-year old Chaplin marries 18-year old Oona O'Neill

July 31, 1944 - Santa Monica, California - Daughter Geraldine Leigh is born

March 7, 1946 - Santa Monica, California - Son Michael John is born

April 11, 1947 - ? - Release of "Monsieur Verdoux"

March 28, 1949 - Santa Monica, California - Daughter Josephine Hannah is born

May 19, 1951 - Santa Monica, California - Daughter Victoria is born

September 18, 1952 - New York City - Chaplin boards the "RMS Queen Elizabeth" for London, where the premiere of "Limelight" was set

September 19, 1952 - in route from United States to England - Chaplin's re-entry permit is revoked by attorney general James P. McGranery, who stated that "he would have to submit to an interview concerning his political views and moral behaviour in order to re-enter the US"

January 1(?), 1953 - Corsier-sur-Vevey, Vaud, Switzerland - After re-entry denial in the US, Chaplin and Oona move to Switzerland

August 23, 1953 - Corsier-sur-Vevey - Son Eugene Anthony is born

July 18, 1954 - Geneva, Switzerland - Dinner with chinese premier Chou En-Lai

April 24, 1956 - London - Dinner with Premier Bulganin at the Claridge Hotel in London, organized by the russian ambassador

May 23, 1957 - Corsier-sur-Vevey(?) - Daughter Jane Cecil is born

September 12, 1957 - Paris(?) - Premiere of "A King in New York". Chaplin banned American journalists from its premiere, and decided not to release the film in the United States

December 3, 1959 - Corsier-sur-Vevey - Daughter Annette Emily is born

July 8, 1962 - Lausanne, Switzerland - Son Christopher James is born

June 22, 1965 - Amsterdam - Chaplin and Oona O'Neill arrive in Amsterdam

June 24, 1965 - Amsterdam - Chaplin receives the Erasmus Prize (shared with Ingmar Bergman)

January 25, 1966 - Iver Heath, Buckinghamshire, England - Chaplin begins filming "A Countess from Hong Kong" at the Pinewood Studios

January 5, 1967 - Iver Heath, England - "A Countess from Hong Kong" is finished filming

May 12, 1971 - Cannes, France - the Festival de Cannes pays tribute to Charlie Chaplin in the presence of the Minister of Culture Jacques Duhamel, come to make him "Commander of the national order of the Legion of Honor

January(?) 1(?), 1972 - New York - Meeting with Tetsuko Kuroyanagi, a leading japanese TV personality

April 10, 1972 - Los Angeles - Charles Chaplin receives Honorary Academy Award

September 3, 1972 - Venice, Italy - Chaplin is awarded the Golden Lion in the Venice Film Festival

January(?) 1(?), 1973 - Corsier-sur-Vevey, Switzerland - Returns to Switzerland (speculative date)

December 2, 1974 - Corsier-sur-Vevey, Vaud, Switzerland(?) - Chaplin is awarded the title of Knight of the Empire

March 4, 1975 - Buckingham Palace, London - Charlie Chaplin receives the title of Knight of the Empire

January(?) 1(?), 1976 - Corsier-sur-Vevey, Switzerland - Returns to Switzerland (speculative date)

December 25, 1977 - Corsier-sur-Vevey, Switzerland - Charlie Chaplin dies during his sleep, aged 88 =(END)
